reviews.review_msg: I reccomend Prof,Stacho to anyone even if you are not so good at math. He has a clear purpose in lectures and that is to make you understand what the concepts are. He doesnt rush through the notes like many other profs. I respect him and his method of teaching. He even gives a few tips to study, they come in handy! Put in work and you will do good.

Lectures were fast, and easy to follow, sometimes difficult to understand him because of his accent, but it is a pretty easy course. Assignments are not difficult, and midterms and final all had marks taken off the total to give everyone a higher percentage! Prof is helpful to the questions you ask him, and will tell you exactly what's on the exams

Jano (Ya-Know) cannot teach for his life. He had to scale both mid-terms significantly and trimmed the total of the final exam from 100 to 75. His inability to translate his knowledge infuriates you as you pay nearly $500 to listen to a person who just arrived from Europe. Lastly, his tests are non calculator and are EXTREMELY hard.

Lets put it this way: when you have to scale both midterms because the class average was a definite fail- we know there is an issue. He tries his best- but he should really stick to what he knows. The material is easy; but he cant teach it.
He seriously needs to work on his penmanship and his english. I find it incomprehensible and I have to rely on my textbook most of the time. Also, he goes through the material in lectures too fast.
